snippet: Exhibits provide a counterpoint to President Vladimir Putin’s agenda.
abstract: Serge Schmemann Editorial Observer describes the way modern politics has intruded upon exhibitions at the Russian Museum and the Hermitage in Russia; notes that many of the current exhibits carry moral and political overtones offering contrast to Pres Vladimir V Putin's agenda, and offer reassurance that the state will never impose proper political behavior on Russian creativity.
lead_paragraph: Exhibits provide a counterpoint to President Vladimir Putin’s agenda.

headline.print_headline: Once Again, Art in Russia Carries Moral and Political Overtones
headline.main: Once Again, Art in Russia Carries Moral and Political Overtones
